text:
Porsche Automobil (ETR:PAH3) Shares Down 0.5% - Here's What Happened Written by MarketBeat January 14, 2026 Share Link copied to clipboard. Image from MarketBeat Media, LLC. Key Points Porsche Automobil Holding SE shares fell 0.5% on Wednesday, trading as low as €37.57 and last at €38.06, with volume of 586,344 shares—about 17% above the average session volume. Valuation and technicals show a market cap of $12.15 billion, a very low P/E of 3.20 and a PEG of 2.65, with a 50‑day moving average of €38.43 and a 200‑day moving average of €36.23. The company operates worldwide in Core and Portfolio Investments as an automobile manufacturer and holds interests in brands including Volkswagen, Audi, Bentley, Lamborghini and Porsche. MarketBeat previews top five stocks to own in February . Get Porsche Automobil alerts: Sign Up Porsche Automobil Holding SE ( ETR:PAH3 - Get Free Report )'s stock price fell 0.5% during trading on Wednesday . The company traded as low as €37.57 and last traded at €38.06. 586,344 shares changed hands during trading, an increase of 17% from the average session volume of 502,739 shares. The stock had previously closed at €38.26. Porsche Automobil Stock Down 0.5%
The business has a 50 day moving average price of €38.43 and a two-hundred day moving average price of €36.23. The stock has a market cap of $12.15 billion, a P/E ratio of 3.20, a price-to-earnings-growth ratio of 2.65 and a beta of 1.31. Porsche Automobil Company Profile ( Get Free Report )
Porsche Automobil Holding SE, through its subsidiaries, operates as an automobile manufacturer worldwide. It operates in two segments, Core Investments and Portfolio Investments. The company is involved in investments in the areas of mobility and industrial technology. It offers its products under the Volkswagen, Audi, SEAT, KODA, Bentley, Lamborghini, and Porsche brand names. The company was formerly known as Dr. Ing. h.c. F. Porsche Aktiengesellschaft and changed its name to Porsche Automobil Holding SE in November 2007. Featured Articles
